package.title: Row Hider
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.5, 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B7 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
Row Hider

Description

This tweak will make a row invisible with Edit Mode: OFF.

This can be used to hide items that you do not want visible to students but need to be available to retain functionality (eg: items containing CSS, Scripts or other content used on the page).

Skill Level
Medium (Simple HTML)
How to Use

  1. Edit any item.

  2. In the text editor, toggle HTML Source Mode add the following code anywhere:

    <div class='hidemyrow'>row</div>

package.title: Add Colour Stripe
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.5, 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B7 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
Add Colour Stripe

Description
This tweak adds a colour stripe to a Blackboard item.
Skill Level
Medium (Simple HTML)
How to Use

  1. Edit any item.

  2. In the text editor, toggle HTML Source Mode add the following code anywhere:

    <span class='colourSpan'>#99BBCCspan>

  3. Replace #99BBCC with a valid HTML hex colour.

    You can use www.colorpicker.com to help you choose a colour code.

package.title: Replace or Hide Icons
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.5, 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B7 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
Replace or Hide Icons

Description
This tweak allows you to replace or hide the standard Blackboard icons.
Skill Level
Easy
How to Use

  1. Add a Blackboard item titled one of the following:

    Standard Icon Replacements

    • Everything Replacement Icon
    • Item Replacement Icon
    • Folder Replacement Icon
    • Title Replacement Icon

    Custom Icon Replacements

    • Replacement Icon: Row Name

    Hiding Icons

    • Hide Icon: Row Name

    Note: Replace Row Name with the full or partial title of item/s you wish to change the icon for.

  2. Use the Add Image button in the Text Editor to upload your custom icon, unless you are using 'Hide Icon'.
Advanced Usage (Simple HTML)

This tweak also accepts using simple HTML to change icons.

  1. Insert the image using the Text Editor to the item itself, then using the HTML mode add <img class='replacemyicon' src='...' alt='...'> to the IMG element you just added

  2. Add <div class='hidemyicon'>Hidden Icon</div> anywhere in HTML mode to a content item to hide it's icon

package.title: Show Hide Text
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.5, 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B7 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
Show Hide Text

Description
This tweak replaces sections of text with a 'Show/hide text' link
Skill Level
Medium (Simple HTML)
How to Use
  1. Create a new item in Blackboard, or edit an existing one.
  2. Write in the Text Editor all the content for this item, then toggle HTML Mode.

  3. Put the following HTML around any text that you wish to replace with a 'Show/hide text' link:

    <div class='hidden'>Your content here</div>
  4. Save and test your tweak.

Optional:

To replace the 'Show/hide text' link with a question or other text, use the following HTML: 

<span id='showHideInstruction'>Your own hide show instruction here</span>

Make sure this custom question goes immeadiatley before the hidden text.

package.title: Image Mapper
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.5, 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B7 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
Image Mapper

Description
This tweak dynamically maps Blackboard resources (folders and links) into an Image Map.
Skill Level
Advanced (Moderate HTML, Image Creation)
How to Use
  1. Create an image or find a copyright-free image to use
  2. Create your folders, links or other content items in Blackboard that your image map will link to.

  3. Generate an image map for your image. Use a web editor such as Dreamweaver (Instructions) or an online image map editor such as maschek.hu/imagemap.

    Make sure you add the exact titles of the folders or links to the ALT tag for each image map area. You can leave href='#'

  4. Create a Blackboard item and add the image using the 'Attach Image' button.

  5. Toggle HTML Source Mode, and add your image map HTML. Make sure to add the usemap='#MyImageMap' attribute to the image.

    Your image map should look similar to this:

    <img border='0' src='[BLACKBOARD IMAGE URL]' alt='My Image Map' usemap='#MyImageMap'/>
    <map name='MyImageMap'>
    <area shape='rect' coords='31,46,100,77' href='#' alt='Link 1'/>
    <area shape='rect' coords='31,106,100,137' href='#' alt='Link 2'/>
    <area shape='rect' coords='398,48,467,79' href='#' alt='Link 3'/>
    <area shape='rect' coords='398,108,467,139' href='#' alt='Link 4'/>
    </map>

Add Print Frame Link

This tweak inserts a 'Print Content' button in the top right hand corner (below Edit Mode button). Clicking this button generates a printer-friendly version of the page, and then opens a Print Dialog window

Easy

package.title: Quick Quiz
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.5, 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B7 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
Quick Quiz

Description
This tweak lets you embed a quick formative quiz in line with your content.
Skill Level
Medium (Simple HTML)
How to Use
  1. Create a new item in Blackboard, or edit an existing one.
  2. On a new line, type in your question text such as 'What is the capital city of Australia?'
  3. Immediately below each question, insert a table with 2 columns and a row for each possible answer.

    eg:

    This is a quiz question. Â What is the answer?
    Is the answer A? No. Try once more.
    Is the answer B? No - have another try!
    Is the answer C? Correct - C is the answer.
  4. In the first column, write in a possible answer. In the adjacent column, write the feedback you wish to provide for this answer
  5. Turn on HTML mode, and add the following DIV tag around your question text to activate it: 
    <div class='quiz'>What is the capital city of Australia?</div>

  6. Save your quick quiz question.

Note: This quiz does not make any attempt to record answers. Use it to provide a self-check of understanding content and concepts

package.title: Make Deep Link
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.5, 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B7 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
Make Deep Link

Description

This tweak will automatically fix direct links to Blackboard folders, ensuring they open correctly in a new window.

Note: Use Blackboard's native 'Unit Links' to link to items within the same unit, as direct links may break when performing a Unit Copy.

Skill Level
Easy (No HTML)
How to Use

  1. Add a Blackboard item named 'Unit Map'. Use the Text Editor to insert an Image, and then Save this item.

  2. Move this new item with your image above the items you wish to have buttons automatically

  3. Create an External Link titled 'Site Link', and paste in the URL to the sub site section

  4. Switch Edit Mode: OFF to test the tweak.

package.title: Load IFRAME as Content
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.5, 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B7 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
This tweak is useful for loading a web package into the full content area of Blackboard.

1. Upload your web package as an attachment to a Blackboard item called 'Web Package' and select 'special action': 'unpackage this file' and submit.
2. Select the web page inside the unpackaged file.
3. Switch to EDIT MODE Off to test web package in student view.

package.title: Add CSS Stylesheet
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.5, 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B7 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
Add CSS Stylesheet

Description
This tweak allows you to load a CSS Stylesheet to the page where this tweak is added.
Skill Level
Advanced (Simple HTML, Custom CSS)
How to Use
  1. Create a new Blackboard item named 'Stylesheet'.
  2. Use the Browse My Computer button to upload your custom .css stylesheet file, or click Browse Unit to reuse a stylesheet you have already added to the site.
  3. Save the item. This row will then be hidden with Edit Mode: OFF.
Additional Options

Optional: Instead of creating a new 'Stylesheet' item, you can add the following HTML markup to any existing content item:

<div class='loadStyle'>Relative URL to your .css File</div>

package.title: Colour Page
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.5, 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B7 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
Colour Page

Description
This tweak changes the background colour of the page
Skill Level
Medium (Simple HTML)
How to Use

  1. Edit any item, then in the text editor toggle HTML Source Mode

  2. Add the following HTML anywhere:

    <span id='colourPage'>colourcode</span>

  3. Replace 'colourcode' in the above example with a valid HTML hex colour you want for the background of the page.

Note: There are a number of online tools available to help choose colour codes, such as colourpicker.com

package.title: Add Coloured Icon Box
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.5 Mac Safari 4 Mac IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
Add Coloured Icon Box

Description
This tweak adds a coloured box with an icon around a block of text.
Skill Level
Medium (Simple HTML)
How to Use

  1. Edit any item, then in the text editor toggle HTML Source Mode

  2. Wrap the text you wish to highlight inside a HTML <div> element, eg:

    <div class='becareful'>Remember to click the 'attach document' button.</div>

  3. Optional: Replace 'becareful' with another valid box name

Additional Options

The following are valid box names:

information magnify message tickblue back next tickgreen becareful issue help

package.title: Dynamic Unit Map Table
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B7 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
Dynamic Unit Map Table

Description
This tweak dynamically maps Blackboard Content Items into a table, based on specially named titles
Skill Level
Medium (Optional HTML, Content Organisation)
How to Use
  1. Create or rename existing items, folder and links on your page with titles that follow this format:

    2. row: column name of resource

    Make sure that the : (colon) character is followed by a space

     

    Examples:
    • Week 1: Lecture Introduction to Schematics
    • Week 2: Lecture Schematics Process
    • Resources: Readings Future Workforce

  2. Create a new Blackboard item, and name it Unit Map.

  3. In the text editor for this new Unit Map, create a table with the right number of rows and columns for your content.

  4. Once you have added the table, fill in the row and column names that you used on your Blackboard Items, leaving the first upper-left cell blank.

    You do not need to change the format of the table, or type into the other cells.

  5. Save and check your table. The tweak will then move items that are correctly named into the table.

Additional Options

This tweak also has additional options for changing the table colour, highlighting cells, collapsing rows together into modules and more.

These extra features do require using the HTML editor, and instructions can be found through the detailed examples link below for more information.

package.title: Self Enrol Link

Self Enrol Link

Note: Self Enrol Tweak will only work if your Organization/Community Site is set up with 'Self Enrolment' option on.

Skill Level

How to Use

  1. Add this tweak to your page, then reposition it as requried.

      2. Optional: To make the Enrol link disappear after enrolment, set Review Status to Enabled for the Tweak.

package.title: Dynamic Unit Map Image
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B10 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
Dynamic Visual Unit Map

Description

This tweak dynamically overlays any image with button-style links to content items (folders, links, tools etc).

It positions and styles the links based on predesigned stylesheet options.

Skill Level
Medium (Image Creation, Content Organisation)
How to Use
  1. Create an image or find a copyright-free image to use. Your image should be 770px (pixels) wide.
  2. Create a Blackboard item named Unit Map for a vertical structure or Unit Navigation for a horizontal structure
  3. Add your image to this new item and then save.
  4. Create your folders, links or other content items that you wish to add as buttons to this image. Their order on the page will determine the appearance of the Visual Unit Map.
Additional Options

The following extra steps can be used to customise the layout and size of your buttons:

Increase the font size of the link

  • Use 'Module...' for a folder's name (this will also add a column break)
  • Use any folder/link name and add 'column header' to its description

Add a Column Break / Start a new Column

  • Use 'Module...' for a folder's name (this will also increase it's size)
  • Use any folder/link name and add 'column break header' to its description

Add a Row Break / Start a new Row

  • Use any folder/link name and add 'row break' to its description

package.title: Checklist

Checklist

This tweak will move the Review buttons on items using Blackboard's native 'Set Review Status (Enabled)' setting into a simple checklist.

  1. Add an item called 'Checklist'.
  2. Enable the Review Status setting by clicking on the context menu icon next to another item and selecting Set Review Status, then on the next page select 'Enabled'.

package.title: Submenu
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.5, 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B7 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
This tweak adds a horizontal submenu based on the content items and subfolders of the current page. The menu can be text only, text overlaying an image or inserted into custom HTML. Integrates with other tweaks - e.g. check the Tweak Example site below for an example which uses Image Map, CSS and Icon replacement to great effect.

1. Add your content items and folders to your page.
2. Add the tweak at the base of the page.
Optional:
3. Add a Content item called 'Menu Image' and insert an image in the content area of the item. Make sure to include image height, width, alt text (and optionally CSS class). The image should be wide enough to accommodate the text of the menu items.

See the Tweak site for advanced examples using custom HTML.

package.title: Load Subsite
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.5, 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B7 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
Load Subsite

Description
This tweak will replace the content area of a page with a fully functional view of another Blackboard Site's content area. It can be useful to load sections of a shared site, without appearing to leave the original site.
Skill Level
Easy (No HTML)
How to Use

  1. Copy the direct link to a folder or content area of another Blackboard site to your clipboard.

    You will need to make sure that you have Edit Mode: OFF, otherwise you will be copying a link that Students / Participants won't be able to access.

    Try visit the link directly by pasting it in your Web Browser to test. You should be taken to the page that already has Edit Mode: OFF and is missing a Blackboard banner across the top of the screen.

  2. Navigate to the site and content area / folder that you wish to show this Subsite.

  3. Create an External Link titled 'Site Link', and paste in the URL to the sub site section

  4. Switch Edit Mode: OFF to test the tweak.

package.title: Load Subsite (Local Domain)
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.5, 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B7 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
This tweak is an extension to load subsite which adds the ability to load local domain sites as well as Blackboard sites into Blackboard. It is useful for loading a section of another site into the full content area or an item of your current Blackboard site (for example - if you have content section created in a shared site that you want embedded in other sites).

1. Copy a link to the section of the sub site (e.g. from the left hand menu, or the Blackboard folder). Make sure you are in EDIT mode OFF -- and that students have guest or enrolled access to the subsite.
2. In the parent Blackboard Site, create an External Link called 'Site Link' (or 'Resource Site Link' to just replace the items content area) and paste in the URL to the sub site section.
3. After adding this Tweak, switch to EDIT Mode Off to see the subsite load.

Banner

package.title: FAQ
package.description: Tested: Firefox 3.6 Safari 5 Mac Chrome B10 IE 7, IE 8
package.instruction:
FAQ

Description
This tweak creates a clickable FAQ section. Answers are hidden until it's associated question is clicked.
Skill Level
Easy
How to Use
  1. Create a new item, and ensure the letters 'FAQ' are somewhere in the item's Title.
  2. In the Text Editor, write your questions followed immediatley by their answers on the next line. Ensure that your questions are in bold format.

    3. eg:

    I am a question.

    And I am an Answer.

    Are you the king of questions?

    No, I'm the king of answers.

  3. Save your FAQ and test to see if the answers appear when clicked.
